title: Football fan arrested after referee is hospitalised during bad-tempered non-league cup final
text:

A man has been arrested after a referee was hospitalised during a non-league cup final. 
An ambulance was called after Bill Pashby was allegedly floored by a supporter who invaded the pitch during the Trophy Trader League Trophy final between Eastway Sports and Goalsports. 
A supporter is accused of jumping the railings surrounding the pitch before charging into the referee, leaving him requiring medical attention. 
Eastway Sports were trailing 2-1 and had been reduced to eight men in the bad-bloodied affair. 
The referee was taken away on a stretcher before an ambulance arrived to continue treatment. 
A North Yorkshire Police spokesman told the Scarborough News: "We were called at about 9pm on Wednesday 29 March to a report that a man in his 60s had been assaulted during a football match in Pickering. 
"Officers attended the scene, and at 11.50pm the same day, a 23-year-old man was arrested at a property in Eastfield on suspicion of wounding with intent. He remains in custody at this time. 
"The victim required hospital treatment for a shoulder injury." 
The match was abandoned with eight minutes left to play following the incident and Goalsports were awarded the trophy. 
"That was a very, very sad end to a cup final," Scarborough and District Saturday League chairman Alan Burnett told the Scarborough News . 
"We condemn this behaviour as a league, there's no place for actions like this at any level of football, let alone grassroots leagues." Like us on Facebook
